info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHERN BOONE AND SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 445 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Aurora, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, penny size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Florence, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Oakbrook, Burlington, Union, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Delhi Township, Delhi Hills, Mack, Wilmington, French, Addyston, Hartford, Idlewild and Waterloo. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 177 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
